meanings.sent1: She always makes sure to presignal her turns while driving.
meanings.sent2: The traffic light presignaling a stop was helpful for drivers.
meanings.sent3: The cat presignaled its intention to pounce on the toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds presignaled an incoming storm.
meanings.sent5: The teacher presignaled the upcoming test by reviewing key concepts.

meanings.definition: The act of signaling before an event occurs
meanings.sent1: The presignaling of the train's arrival was clear with the sound of the whistle.
meanings.sent2: Presignaling is important in emergency situations to warn others.
meanings.sent3: The presignaling of the surprise party almost gave it away.
meanings.sent4: The presignaling of the earthquake saved many lives.
meanings.sent5: The presignaling of the fireworks show excited the crowd.
